meta.title: Easy Pizza
meta.description: This classic pizza recipe makes enough dough for 2 12-inch pies. You can freeze half of the dough to make later, or make both at once!
meta.time: about 1 hour, plus about 1 hour to rise

ingredients.name: active dry yeast
ingredients.notes: If you don't use bulk yeast, this is equivalent to one standard packet. Any kind of yeast will work, but instant yeast will rise the fastest.

ingredients.name: olive oil
ingredients.notes: Any kind of vegetable oil will work, but olive oil has the best taste for pizza.

ingredients.name: grated Parmesan cheese
ingredients.notes: Feel free to substitute Pecorino Romano or Asiago, or omit entirely.

ingredients.name: Mozzarella cheese
ingredients.notes: If you are using shredded cheese, this is equivalent to about 1 cup.

ingredients.name: Oregano
ingredients.notes: Feel free to use any Italian herb blend if you don't have oregano.

steps.instructions: Mix 2 tsp. yeast with 1 cup of warm water.

steps.caption: make a batter
steps.instructions: Stir until dissolved, then add 1 tsp. salt and stir again.

steps.caption: add seasoning
steps.instructions: Add 2 cups flour, and mix until smooth.

steps.caption: cut cauliflower
steps.instructions: Add 1 cup more flour, and mix until all or almost all of the flour is incorporated.

steps.caption: batter the cauliflower
steps.instructions: Place the dough on a lightly-floured table, and gently knead until smooth and stretchy.

steps.caption: spread the cauliflower
steps.instructions: Pour about a tablespoon of olive oil in a large bowl, and add the dough. Turn the dough over in the bowl until fully coated. Put the dough in a warm place and allow to rise for at least an hour or until it has doubled in size.

steps.caption: melt butter
steps.instructions: Drizzle a pizza pan with oil, and brush or wipe it to cover the entire pan.

steps.caption: make the sauce
steps.instructions: Turn the dough out onto a lightly floured table, and knead a few more times, adding flour if needed to prevent it from sticking to the table.

steps.caption: melt butter
steps.instructions: Divide the dough in half. If you only want to make one pie now, place one of the pieces of dough in a zip-lock bag and freeze for up to a month, or refrigerate for up to a day.

steps.caption: melt butter
steps.instructions: Press the dough into the oiled pizza pan, stretching it to fill the entire pan.

steps.caption: add the sauce
steps.instructions: Slice or shred 4oz. of mozzarella cheese.

steps.caption: add the sauce
steps.instructions: Drizzle the pizza with oil, and brush or wipe to coat evenly.

steps.caption: add the sauce
steps.instructions: Lightly sprinkle the crust with Parmesan cheese, and spread about 1/3 cup of sauce over the crust, leaving room around the edges.

steps.caption: add the sauce
steps.instructions: Arrange the cheese and spinach on the pizza.

steps.caption: bake
steps.instructions: Bake the pizza on the top rack of a 450°F oven for 7-10 minutes, or until the crust and cheese have lightly browned.

steps.caption: add the sauce
steps.instructions: Remove the pizza from the oven, and allow to cool before slicing.
